alert.note: Alert for Washington (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 13 at 4:38PM EST until January 14 at 12:08AM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mettawee River At Granville. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Minor flood stage. Widespread flooding of fields along the river. Water on Upper Turnpike Road and Gray Lane. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:15 PM EST Friday the stage was 6.95 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 7.1 feet. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.0 feet on 07/24/2004. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Mettawee River Granville Flood Stage: 7.0 Observed Stage at Fri 4 pm: 6.95 Forecast: Fri 7 pm 6.9 Sat 1 am 6.5 Sat 7 am 6.4 Sat 1 pm 6.2 Sat 7 pm 6.1 Sun 1 am 5.9 Sun 7 am 5.8 Sun 1 pm 5.7 Sun 7 pm 5.6 Mon 1 am 5.5 Mon 7 am 5.4 &&
